So one way to do this is you can define your each method in Ruby and that's what allows you to be iterable. And then you can manually call like, errors each and then pass the block and do all the nonsense you need to do, okay? You just write def delegators and you tell it what child and then you tell it what methods you want to forward and it just handles the forwarding for you. That's nice. It's really nice.
